tasks.task: Irrigation and Watering Practices in Agriculture}
subtasks: Understanding the essentiality of water in plant survival
Recognizing the percentage of a plant's composition and its functions
Identifying the role of irrigation in crop watering
Explaining the factors determining the right time and amount of water for crops
Differentiating between the need for water in various crops (e.g., paddy vs. wheat)
Considering soil type’s impact on water retention (e.g., sandy vs. clayey soil)
Adapting irrigation practices based on seasonal changes
Identifying sources of irrigation water (groundwater, surface water, non-conventional sources)
Describing traditional irrigation methods (pulley system, chain pump, liver system, furrow irrigation)
Explaining the efficiency and sustainability benefits of modern irrigation methods (sprinkler, drip irrigation)
Understanding the components of modern irrigation systems (e.g., motorized pumps)
Summarizing the evolution of irrigation techniques from traditional to modern practices
